result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda J. Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Amanda J. Peters

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Seek and maintain employment, or status as a student, or a combination of the two, commensurate with her treatment needs, at the agent's discretion.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.
Submit to a mental health evaluation, if the agent deems it necessary.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Credit for 70 days, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Parties have the revocation packet.  Attorney Poss made a comment regarding an allegation in the revocation packet.  State recommended:  9 months jail in 16CF60 with 228 days credit.  6 months jail in 17CF124 with 217 days credit.  Defense agrees with the State.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  Court ordered:   9 months jail in 16CF60 with 228 days credit.  6 months jail each count in 17CF124 with 217 days credit. All concurrent.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
and Revocation Summary
From DOC agent with revocation packet
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 20, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction - Return to Sender - Attempted Not Known - Unable to Forward

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1 in 16CF60.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 2 in 16CF262.  Remaining counts in each case, plus 16FO739 all dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court advised the possible penalties in the counts the defendant plead to.  She understood.  Felony warnings given by the court to the defendant.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g) and in 16CF262, Resist/Obstruction, contrary to 946.41(1)(a) as a repeater. 946.41(1) .  Joint recommendation in 16CF60.  3 years probation. 16CF262, 2 years probation.  Concurrent.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  70 days credit, per Attorney Sebion.  

Court ordered sentence withheld: 16CF60- 3 years probation. In 16CF262- 2 years probation.  Concurrent with any other probation now serving.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Credit for 70 days, if revoked.  Mental health evaluation, if agent recommends.  Seek and maintain employment/school, commensurate with her treatment needs, at agent's discretion.
